main event: A single star-shaped object was observed in the sky over the Atlantic Ocean on December 16, 1961.
interesting points: The object was observed visually from an aircraft at an altitude of 6,000 feet, without the use of optical aids.
The object was first observed at an elevation of 15 degrees and an azimuth of 220 degrees, and disappeared over the horizon at an azimuth of 257 degrees.
The object was the size of a pinhead and had the brightness and color of a first magnitude star.
The observers' attention was attracted by the movement of the object in relation to the stars.
The plane commander evaluated the object as a probable satellite.
